Are you using ExtractorUniversal by any chance? A bug that coudl 
cause this was fixed about 2 weeks ago in SVN TRUNK and is not yet 
in any release.

- Gordon @ IA

Purvesh Shah wrote:
> 
> 
> Hello,
> 
> When I am running a crawl, I get messages like one mentioned below after 
> having crawled a bunch of pages successfully.  There are no other errors 
> in the local-errors log that are related to the threads that are listed 
> in the 'ROS already open' error.
> 
> Could someone please provide a clue w.r.t. what could be causing the 
> stream to remain open?  Is this a known issue?
> 
> One of the error messages:
> 
> 2007-07-18T21:03:14.039Z    -2          - 
> http://web03.eng.endeca.com/theonion/www.theonion.com/content/node/38546.html 
> LLL 
> http://web03.eng.endeca.com/theonion/www.theonion.com/content/node/35627.html 
> no-type #046 - - - le:IOException@HTTP
>  java.io.IOException: ROS already open for ToeThread #46: 
> http://web03.eng.endeca.com/theonion/www.theonion.com/content/node/38546.html
>         at 
> org.archive.io.RecordingOutputStream.open(RecordingOutputStream.java:188)
>         at org.archive.util.HttpRecorder.outputWrap(HttpRecorder.java:166)
>         at 
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.open(HttpConnection.java:758)
>         at 
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:386)
>         at 
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:170)
>         at 
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:396)
>         at 
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:346)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.innerProcess(FetchHTTP.java:500)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process(Processor.java:112)
>         at 
> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:302)
>         at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:151)
> 
> Please let me know if more details are needed w.r.t. the crawl-job.
> 
> Thank you very much for your time and support.
> 
> Best,
> Purvesh.
